Reviews.Title: Fantastic picture quality!
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: My picture settings are towards the end of the review, for those interested.I am a avid sports fan and gamer, and was looking for a new TV. I bought this TV to replace a 42" Panasonic TC-L42U25. I really liked that TV, but wanted a size upgrade. I did my research, and was originally looking at a Vizio E601i-A3. I went into an electronics Big Box store to look at it, and honestly wasn't impressed at all. The price was definitely right, but I really didn't need a smart TV since I have an Xbox and Playstation. The salesman then showed me a Samsung that was on sale, and it was better than the Vizio, but I still wasn't sure. Then they showed me this Sharp, and I immediately noticed the difference. Colors looked lifelike (most important thing about a TV to me), the size was great, and the price was right.I played with the settings in the store some in order to figure out what it looked like when not in Dynamic mode (I strongly recommend playing with the picture settings in store- you'll never use a TV at the Dynamic setting if you're looking for picture accuracy), and I got it to look a lot more lifelike than the other two TVs I mentioned. Football and baseball look outstanding, regular TV looks great, and video games do just fine- no major input lag that I can detect. I then ordered it from Amazon, and haven't looked back so far! Sound quality is just ok, definitely tinny, but I use a surround sound system like most people nowadays. It has 3 HDMI inputs (which should be plenty, especially with a passthrough surround sound receiver like I have), an optical out for other surround sound/soundbar connections, and composite/component connections. I sit approximately 10 feet away from it, and it fits perfectly. I was worried at first about it being too big for my apartment living room, but it's great!One drawback to this TV (and really most LED TVs now) is the viewing angle. The Panasonic TV I used to have had an IPS (In Plane Switching) panel that made the picture look as good as 170 degrees as it did looking straight on. The one 'problem' I have with the TV is that somewhere around 40-45 degrees off center, the colors start to wash out. Not a big deal in my living room, but if you have a big room or won't be watching from center, it's something to think about. Again, most LED TVs now have this problem, so it's not a dealbreaker and you're unlikely to find one without this issue in the price range.Here are my picture settings:Mode: MovieOPC: OffBacklight: -3Contrast: 25Brightness: 0Color: -3Tint: 0Sharpness: 5Advanced:Color temp: HighMotion Enhancement: On (low) /I usually turn this off when I'm not watching sports to avoid the "soap opera effect"Film Mode: Off:Active Contrast: OffDigital Noise Reduction: MiddleThese work for me in a semi-bright living room. Other reviewers have noted they can't get skin to look natural, but I think I did ok. I have found that some networks look more 'red' than others, but that's not something the TV can fix. Black levels are great for an LED TV. I calibrated the TV using a Planet Earth Bluray, and I felt like I was right there in the middle of it- outstanding picture quality (I can't stress that enough!). If your budget is right around the 4 figure mark, I think this is an excellent choice.PS- The shipping was great, and Amazon price matched the TV when their price dropped just after I bought it. Amazon Customer Service has never let me down!

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture / basic sound
Reviews.Author: Greg Pavlik
Reviews.Content: This TV has an top quality picture.  The sound is marginal and for best sound will require connection to a receiver or sound bar.Pros:* Outstanding picture:  Color is rich and vibrant; fast motion is clean; no artifacts from the LED back lighting.* Good mechanical design: TV is very thin, lightweight, and has a very narrow bezel; matte finish reduces glare from windows and lights.Cons:* No smart TV features:  No connections to services like Netflix or Amazon.  Most smart TV interfaces are pretty bad anyway, so a $99 RoKu 3 is a better option than paying more for a TV with these features.* Sound is basic.  High quality sound will require connection to a receiver or sound bar.Tips:* The way the TV ships it has some fairly serious overscan.  I'm running XBMC and initially went into its settings to adjust the picture size.  It overscanned by about 30 pixels on all four sides.  After a lot of poking around in the menu, I found a setting called "dot by dot" and set the TV to use this display mode.  Set to this mode, there is no overscan issue at all and I was able to remove the overscan correction from XBMC.* You can turn off the power LED from the menu.  I personally find the power ID annoying while watching TV and it's nice to have this feature.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: Robert Dellaquila
Reviews.Content: The color, brightness, clarity is amazing. You cannot go wrong especially for this price. I love everything about this tv, I've had LG, Samsung, and Vizio. The LG had bleedthroughs with the black. This tv's color (blacks) is excellent. No bleeding effect. You will be completely satisfied for this price and quality. A+

Reviews.Title: Amazing piece of entertainment tech
Reviews.Author: J. Cocchini
Reviews.Content: 2 WEEK UPDATE: The picture remains incredibly natural and visually pleasing.  As with other HD TVs, it is merciless when presented with inferior video.  I think that maybe the 'realism' feature may be a letdown for some that prefer artificially 'vibrant' to 'realistic' - maybe not.  The auto bright adjustment for ambient conditions is awesome.  Ran into the sound bar problem when connecting to the TV using a fiber optic link.  Got around this by running the Vizeo VBS200 sound bar/optical port out of the DVR (Hopper).  Also downloaded a recent firmware update that purports to improve use of the TV w/an external sound bar, but haven't tested that assertion.  The TV is indeed 'dumb', which I am very happy for, since the DVR has wireless/wired networking, Pandora, etc.Was going to get a 55' LG non-smart 120Hz - truly amazing picture quality.  HOWEVER, the Aquos has such ridiculously natural rendering, it's almost anticlimactic.  Almost.It seems unfair to ding the TV for the USB "not working", when a little bit of research reveals that the USB port is for service only.I have noticed two general classes of computer and TV displays: those with all manner of adjustments, and those with quite a few available adjustments, but limited when compared to similar products.  I have also noticed that in general, the name brand displays with more basic controls, generally start out with a better visual experience in the first place.  The Aquos seems like the latter type; plenty of adjustment capability, but not overboard.  And it seems appropriate, given the quality of the baseline viewing experience.The remote is epically ugly to the point that it seems purposeful.  It does however function.  Most folks I would think are going to have a DISH/DirecTV/Logitech/Xbox/Sony/other remote that will function as the primary for this TV.  FYI: The DISH Hopper remote can be programmed from the Hopper itself (NO HAND/CODE PROGRAMMING!).The sound is passable; nothing more. Seems to me all the really thin TVs [I know of] have marginal audio.  A hundred dollar sound bar like the Vizio VSB200 remedies the situation nicely.The low power consumption is a really welcome surprise.  The power cord is about equivalent to the under-cabinet radio in my kitchen, suggesting a very low current requirement.  The EnergyStar rating says it cost 20 bucks/year to run the thing.  I doubt it's that low, but it's not likely to be much higher.

Reviews.Title: Very much enjoying this TV.....
Reviews.Author: Boozwaa
Reviews.Content: Have had it for a week now and so far I really like it. Not going to go too technical in this review, but I had this and the Panasonic 58 inch smart TV in my cart for some time trying to decide if I really needed a smart TV or not. The Panasonic  was a smart TV, this sharp was not and was 2 inches bigger. I already have a Roku so I figure I probably did not  really need the Smart features. I went to a big box store and saw both of these.  I thought the picture quality was pretty much the same The Panasonic had the better speakers. The speakers on the Sharp is very portable radio like. I figure I would get a sound bar to go with it, which I was intending to do anyway. Amazon, the next day had a Lightening deal for this  Sharp TV that included a sharp sound bar and the Google Chrome Cast for $899. So this pretty much seal the deal for me.After some tweaking of the settings to my taste, I concluded that this was one awesome TV and deal that I got for the money.  I turned off the OPC feature. I  thought  during the night time the feature made the picture a bit too dark. During the day in a bright room it works fine and is a nice feature to have.  I have no complaints at all about the picture. Love how thin the TV is.  Once it was set up on the stand it seemed lighter  than it really is. I  was able to lift it up ( slow and carefully) by myself on to the entertainment center.  The Sharp sound bar that came with the bundle is absolutely awesome sounding.Very satisfied with this TV in terms of picture and how thin it is, but one star off for the TV speakers.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Fit
Reviews.Author: Pokey
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is amazing! Delivered really fast and in excellent condition. Looks perfect in my newly finished basement family room.

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase
Reviews.Author: TrooperChicago42
Reviews.Content: It may not have all the bells and whistles that are out there for TV (Like internet/you tube, etc) but this Flat Screen is an excellent choice to get if you are looking for a solid picture and high quality HD.  Great price and a Great buy!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money, but a minor issue when connect to PC via HDMI.
Reviews.Author: S. Stenton
Reviews.Content: The TV is nice, has a good picture, and with the dynamic and automatic backlight adjustment it works well when it's bright in the room, and when it gets dark the picture dims, all automatically and adjustable in range. I am using this primarily connected via a laptop with HDMI for Amazon Prime video, Netflix, and other online video services. And also with a PS3 for games. I upgraded from an older 37" Samsung after moving into a larger place. I have the TV hanging on the wall at a height of 94" to the top, and the backrest of my couch is 14 feet from the screen. It's more than big enough for watching TV, or playing intensive video games (like GTA). With the old 37" watching tv was bearable from the couch, but playing games required moving a chair closer to the tv.My only gripe with this TV is that there seems to be some kind of bug in the TV's firmware when getting an HDMI signal from my PC, the image is shifted to the right by about 4 pixels, leaving a black bar 4 pixels wide on the left side of the screen, and cutting 4 pixels off the right. Now on a screen this size it is completely un-noticable when watching videos full screen, and only barely noticable when navigating in Windows (the scroll bar on the right of a screen will be every so slightly cut off). I am waiting to hear back from Sharp's support on the issue, after searching around the net i found someone who had the same problem with a Panasonic tv, and pansonic had addressed the issue and posted a firmware update to fix it. I'm hoping Sharp does the same.I'm certain that the issue is with the TV itself and not with my computer's settings because this never occurred on my old Samsung TV.

Reviews.Title: So far so good... some reviews are incorrect about audio issue
Reviews.Author: Harrison W "Harrison W"
Reviews.Content: I just recently got this and so far, the picture looks very crisp.This is replacing an LG SmartTV and in my opinion, SmartTV is lightyears behind Set Top Boxes like Roku and Apple TV.People are complaining that audio won't pass through from HDMI to an output source. That is incorrect or out of date. My unit is outputting audio in 5.1 from my Apple TV to a H/K receiver via Optical Digital... no issue at all.Bottom line- If you're looking for a good quality panel at a decent  price and you don't care about SmartTV or sound quality- it's a safe bet.Haven't tested the sound quality of the built in speakers yet but nearly all LED TVs have bad speakers. That's the price you pay for having a really thin TV.

Reviews.Title: Great so far!
Reviews.Author: Michael "Mike"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this around the holidays 2013. I was looking for a new TV and have seen and talked to owners of the Sharp Aquos Family. It has not dissapointed. I did not pay the extra for the "smart" version because I have an XBOX One and Google Chromecast so it was completely unessesary.

Reviews.Title: Wow...
Reviews.Author: Radoslaw P.
Reviews.Content: Big picture, not big money.  If you are looking for the best bang for your buck this set is it.  Bought mine at PC Richards for $798.99.  Love it...

Reviews.Title: Sharp LC-60LE550 60-inch Aquos 1080p 120Hz LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: ckc
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV Met my expectations, I didn't want a smart TV since we use ROKU and the streaming movies in HD are great, now we have to upgrade to HD with our cable provider or go to a different service to really enjoy the picture! Delivery went off exactly as stated, better than hauling it home from the Box Store, set it right in my living room.

Reviews.Title: First Glance/preliminary
Reviews.Author: Dale Swanson
Reviews.Content: Too new for complete review but this is my first impression:Price paid: $799.00/no tax/no shipping  - 5 *Setup: Fairly easy but needs better remote setup as all functions but on/off transferred — 4*Auto light control:  seems too dark at factory settings/will tweak manually — 4*3 HDMI:  Would like 4 - 4*Sound:  Better than my Samsung 40" — will use home theater — 4*.Picture: Clear, bright w/OLP off — haven't played with settings yet — 4*Controls: Side controls convenient - 5*.Remote: Would like a little larger format w/lighted keys/buttons — 3*.Potential after manual settings and surround sound receiver added — 5*.

Reviews.Title: Picture pretty good but DOES NOT WORK WITH SOUNDBAR
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey "GP"
Reviews.Content: I like the looks of this TV but it has one fatal flaw: it does not work with a sound bar.  When it detects and HDMI signal, it shuts down the digital audio pass through.  This is something Sharp admits, but, for obvious reasons, doesn't advertise.  If you want to use a sound bar with your TV, or anything that uses pass-through audio, make sure you check the manufacturer's list of approved TV's.  Almost none of Sharp's work, for the above reason.  Also, I had a terrible time getting this TV delivered.  It may have been the local delivery in my area, but Amazon needs to do a better job securing their delivery partners if they're going to sell things too big for UPS.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV for someone who just wants a TV
Reviews.Author: D.M.
Reviews.Content: I'm extremely satisfied with this TV.  I wanted a basic TV with high picture quality, no smart features, no 3D, just a TV and this one is awesome.  I have it hooked up to my computer and xbox 360, which is why I just wanted a big monitor.  I upgraded from a much lower quality brand and I can really tell the difference in the contrast when I'm playing a game with bright lights at night.  It looks awesome.  This one also has plenty of inputs.  When shopping I had a very hard time deciding between this one and a Samsung with similar specs and the same price.  I read some things about the matte finish Sharp uses giving less issue with glare, which matters in my apartment where I can't control the light very well.  Regardless, I am very happy with my purchase.  The enhanced delivery service was great too.  The delivery people unpacked and set it up for me.  I had to rearrange all the plugs when they left, but that's beside the point.

Reviews.Title: OUTSTANDING VALUE AND PERFORMANCE
Reviews.Author: Anthony R. Carbone
Reviews.Content: The Sharp television 60 inch version is outstanding with great picture quality.  One of the other reviewers posted their preferred settings and they worked perfectly.  I would suggest these settings every time unless another person found their own adjustments that worked better.  Do not expect the picture to look perfect out of the box with out some type of adjustment.  The more research a person does before the purchase will only enhance their entire experience with this television.One other note is many complained of the audio on this set.  While the sound does not come close to a 5.1 system or a 7.1 system it is still outstanding if a person does not expect a surround sound experience.  My highest rating on a great buy and if a person does not need WiFi and or a smart TV this TV is one of the best choices in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Basic TV Means a Basic Price Point.
Reviews.Author: Xarkzila
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV because it DIDN'T have ALL the bells and whistles!  3D?  After reading up on this it appears that 3D is not all it's cracked up to be.  Very few releases and quality just isn't there yet, plus 3D broadcast channels are shutting down due to lack of interest, so who needs it?  (I find it tiring to watch in 3D, anyway and upconverts to 3D are very poor.)  Smart TV?  Really?  My BD/DVD player is a Smart system as is my Playstation.  Adding a Smart TV is simply overkill.  So, this TV fits the bill as a low cost alternative.  Other than not being 3D or "Smart" there is nothing else missing!  On setup, the TV insisted on "finding" a channel.  Not that I intended to use the TV input, (I have sattelite,) but I attached the small wire that was supplied as an FM antenna with my BD/DVD player and I was amazed.  The system picked up 30+ channels!  I then purchased a digital antenna and was disappointed as with a digital antenna attached I couldn't get a single channel, so back to the little wire where reception is amazing!If you're looking for a large screen that provides a great picture this is it!  Sound from the unit itself is OK, but I got this more for movies and games than for broadcast TV.  (Other than football, of course!)  I added a full surround system for sound so the TV speakers won't be getting much use anyway.  Though they were fine for football this weekend!  There are more than enough options for adjusting the color, tint and color temperature but I didn't find that to be necessary.  (Still I played with them and found settings that were more pleasing in the room where the TV is installed.)I have this TV in a room where there are no windows, but did check with lights to determine if there were any glare issues and the screen seems to diffuse most reflective problems.  I even took a photo, straight on, with a flash, and it only washed a small area where the flash was directly pointed, leaving the rest of the picture crystal clear.  I also like the automatic backlight, which adjusts screen brightness depending on the amount of light in the room.  Using the "store" settings the screen is too bright for my room, so there's plenty of backlight, brightness and contrast in reserve.  Optimum viewing distance appears to be 7-8 feet for a full immersive effect.  WIth full surround, it's like being in the theater!For size vs price, I don't think you can do any better than this TV.

Reviews.Title: Good Picture, horrible sound options.
Reviews.Author: Brad Bennett "ShadowBorn1975"
Reviews.Content: The picture on this tv is really good. Sound is the drawback.  According to the Sharp tech support I spoke with, when using HDMI inputs, the optical output is shut off, so you cannot use the tv as a passthrough to a soundbar or receiver.  I was told you can use analog inputs and the optical output???? In what world does that make any sense at all?

Reviews.Title: Great Purchaced
Reviews.Author: Raymond Matte
Reviews.Content: Would recommend to everyone. I also think it was an awesome buy for the price very happy I purchased it.

Reviews.Title: Aquos LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: jack ogindo
Reviews.Content: The product is efficient, sharp and easy to  use. No problems thus far encountered and Thanks for everything.! My family enjoys every moment  with it.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat it for the price
Reviews.Author: Eric Colliflower
Reviews.Content: The picture is ultra clear, crisp, and bright.  The autosensing for brightness is outstanding.  The sound level and quality is fantastic.  Overall, I am blown away by the quality even without considering the price but once the price is considered, it is even better.

Reviews.Title: I love my new Sharp Aquos 60-inch
Reviews.Author: Edwin Echevarria
Reviews.Content: Great colors, clear picture and great sport action screen. I like the auto picture adjustment to the current room light environmnent.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: RJJ "J"
Reviews.Content: Great TV if you don't want/need a Smart TV. I already had Roku and enjoy that so this was perfect. Image quality is great, sound quality is just fine. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Dude!  An awesome TV!
Reviews.Author: Gene Larson
Reviews.Content: Can't describe the happiness our new television has brought us.  The size and screen detail is outstanding - the colors are beyond belief.

Reviews.Title: Best bang for the buck!
Reviews.Author: Mozzer101
Reviews.Content: I love this TV. Although it does not have any smart tv features it's a great buy. You can't go wrong with a sharp. My only CON is the sound quality. I would think by now these new TV's would have outstanding sound. Also only 3 HDMI.

Reviews.Title: Price is right, but contrast is terrible
Reviews.Author: RcketScientist
Reviews.Content: I'd give it three stars if they didn't claim a ridiculous 4 million: 1  contrast ratio and deliver nowhere near that.  It makes you realize that they truly do design the metric to fit whatever they want to put on the box.I bought this as an upgrade to a 40" quatron.  That tv was fantastic and the image quality was unsurpassed.  I didn't hesitate to pick up another Sharp.  However I am slightly regretting this decision.  While the size moved up the image quality went down drastically.  I'm not entirely sure if it's directly related to moving from a quatron to this panel but the contrast does not even remotely meet the claims.  In fact I can't even calibrate this TV.  The contrast is so low that the calibration metrics don't even fully show up.  It's missing about 3% in black and about 2% in white.  Doesn't sound like a whole lot but -5% of ideal is certainly not 4 million : 1.Technical jargon doesn't always translate to viewing, but unfortunately in this case it does.There is a noticeable loss of detail in shadows and highlights in movies.Where it really detracts is gaming.  For those familiar with setting gamma in games, I often can't even see the watermark that's used for calibrating gamma at it's highest setting.  That's regardless of contrast/brightness on the TV.  When playing dark games the loss of shadow detail is crippling.  I have to bump up the brightness at the detriment of image quality in order to play.If you're not picky and don't watch dark movies or play dark games you'll do just fine with this TV.  If not, steer clear.  I'll be stuck with this thing for a while and I'm not so happy about that.  I've gone from a Sharp fan to never buying Sharp again.

Reviews.Title: I don't hate it, but I don't love it either.
Reviews.Author: Kellie
Reviews.Content: We looked around for a few weeks for a bigger TV for our living room and based on features, price, and the picture quality, we ended up choosing this one, but I'm actually regretting not getting the LG.  The HD quality is good, but the picture has that feeling you get when you watch a live news report.  It feels too "real".  Not sure why that is.  Also, the TV is smart in that it adjusts the brightness based on the brightness of the room.  What a pain!  Really what happens:  when you are watching one of those "dark" movies and it is night or there is low light in your viewing room... it lowers the brightness on the tv and you can't see anything.  It's a nice feature (I guess) if you like to watch tv in the dark as it adjusts and is less harsh on your eyes, but doesn't help me if I can't see what's going on and really irritates me to have to find the remote and adjust the brightness.  It is very light for its size and very thin.  The picture is crisp and the remote is actually pretty basic which is nice.  I really don't need 100 buttons on my remote to feel complete.  It was easy to set up and has an adequate number of HDMI inputs.  I can't say I'd recommend this one, but I think it's a personal preference.  If you've had Aquos tv's before and liked them, then you will probably like this one.  If you prefer LG, I'd stick with LG.

Reviews.Title: Internet gave it too much credit
Reviews.Author: BT
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV thinking that while, yes, its entry level...I should still be able to calibrate it.  Well, unfortunately that wasn't true.  No matter how I got this TV tuned, it always looked poor.  Crushed blacks, washed out whites and sunburnt skin.  If you only strive for a large TV and don't really care much about color accuracy, then you will be fine with this unit.I myself had it returned and will be purchasing the amazing Vizio 2014 M series 70".

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny.
Reviews.Author: Dave the wise
Reviews.Content: It has Great picture, Vibrant colors, and Dark darks. Awesome deal. No complaints here. A great addition to any home theatre.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: matt
Reviews.Content: Best speakers I have experienced in a led tv. Picture is great and the power saving on the tv is awesome if u fall asleep.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV!!
Reviews.Author: Palma Solane "perfect contrast"
Reviews.Content: For the price, i am very happy with this TV. After tweaking the picture settings, my VUDU has never looked better. I love the thin bezel on it as well; makes it look like you are just staring at screen. I also love the fact its so dang light and I actually mounted it by myself. So here are the settings that i found work best for meBack light=13, Contrast=33 Brightness=0, Color=4, tint=0, Sharpness=4.

Reviews.Title: it OK
Reviews.Author: David Ross "happy camper"
Reviews.Content: it does what it is suppose to do It was easy to set up and turn on. Quality was so so

Reviews.Title: Great looking tv, audio is okay color is great.
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: Looks great hung on my wall.  Opted to not go for the 650 model as my xbox will do the wifi and has any apps I wish.Speaker at the bottom is a bit large but not causing any issues, just an observation.Audio suffices but I will be working on getting a sound bar soon.  Very minor flash lighting but for that price it's not enough to piss me off.  Picked this up for 899 so couldn't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV. Great picture and sound! Shouldn't have waited so long to buy it! Sharp has blown me away!
Reviews.Author: Mike F
Reviews.Content: Beautiful TV. Super shipping and delivery. Great price.My son recommended the Sharp and he was dead on. Beat all the other TV's we looked at, hands down.

Reviews.Title: My Christmas wish to myself completed and I am so happy!
Reviews.Author: Esmeralda Allen "Esmeralda Reyes Allen"
Reviews.Content: I love my new TV .. sharp, exceptional color and big as I like it, especially for watching my SciFi movies with lots of action.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Caleb Sindt
Reviews.Content: Great TV. Not hard to set up, suggest getting a surround sound system with it just for a theater like experience.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, poor sound
Reviews.Author: ferg "ferg"
Reviews.Content: Great TV, speakers are terrible, which seems to be the norm of these super thin TVs.  I noticed a of people ask "is this a smart TV".  No, it is NOT a smart TV, however, if you have a game system such as PS4, Xbox (or XboxOne), buying  smart TV is a waste of money.  Current game systems have more aps than many smart TVs.  This TV is thin, light-weight, and fairly simple to set up, although I would recommend downloading the operator manual from the Sharp website, as the printed version it comes with is printed so small a magnifying glass is needed.  Also, as long as your speakers have an optical audio cable, they are compatible.  I have an LG external speaker that works great on this TV.  As I said before, the internal speakers on this unit are awful, and I highly suggest getting a sound bar along with it.

Reviews.Title: Skin Tones Looked Awful
Reviews.Author: Scott McFarland
Reviews.Content: I lived with this TV for 10 days and each night I spent time trying to get the colors to look good.  And I couldn't.  Green, brown, and black looked strong.  Whites tended to be distractingly bright, unless I muted down brightness to the point of dulling everything.  Any attempt to use the automatic light adjustment dulled the picture down severely.  But the biggest problem was the reds.The reds seemed naturally dull, and difficult to control in relation to the other colors.  The end result was that every Caucasian's skin tone was (depending on tweaks) either coming out red with severe sunburn, or as pale as a corpse.  I couldn't get the skin tones not to be a distraction. My best tweak for Caucasian skin actually had everything so far out of wack that you could not discern an African-American from a white person with a tan.  I was watching a WNBA game and could hardly tell the white players from the black ones.  Skin tone was awful on this with the presets and with every tweak I tried.  Perhaps I'm spoiled from years of looking at my Sony, but I couldn't make do with this.In the end I returned it to Best Buy; the woman working returns told me they had other returns on this product with the same complaint.  Caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: Dumbest of the Dumb
Reviews.Author: Matthew Lawrence "specialguest"
Reviews.Content: This is not a smart TV, but a dumb TV. And that is a good thing...So for those that don't need a smart TV, and want size, and (relative) quality for the lowest possible price, this may be the one for you!First of all, you get what you pay for. Keep that in mind. This is not going to blow your mind, but if your current HDTV is a mid grade or or less around 5 or more years old, it will impress. The lack of features also extends to the user menu unfortunately, so the options to tweak or self calibrate will leave home tuners wanting. Red and green have some issues, but that is expected if paying less than $2000.Overall this set can be fantastic if it is what you need. If you want solid quality and don't want the input lag or cost of additional features you may want to invest your dollars here.

Reviews.Title: ***** Wow *****
Reviews.Author: Smitty Ditty from Detroit City
Reviews.Content: ***** Wow, We received our 70" Sharp LED August 23,2013 --- Man, what a beautiful picture! We've only had this puppy a few days but, we can't tell you how wonderful and joyous this addition to our family has been. The color was terrible at first so we experimented with the controls for a while -- patience my friends -- If we can do it -- anyone can --  Talk about HD -- Man, this puppy is so picture brilliant it's like a dream come true. ** We'll write back if there's any change in our "Love Affair" -- for now, we're in Love with our new puppy...

Reviews.Title: Flickering, unwatchable screen after ~20 days
Reviews.Author: CB
Reviews.Content: I was really excited when we bought this on a Black Friday sale last month: it's my first TV, and my wife and I were tired of watching TV on her laptop.What fools we were.First, setting it up was far from intuitive.  Maybe I'm just living in the past, but I expected a TV of the plug-it-in-and-work variety.  Nope, scrolled through this menu and that trying to turn off the auto-dim feature.  I'm sure it saves energy or whatever, but it also makes the picture dim enough that you have to squint to see it.  And good luck seeing it at all if you're not in a pitch-black room with that auto-dim feature on.But I persisted and overcame, and an hour or so later had a functioning TV.  I'd even put together a sweet Raspberry Pi/RaspBMC media center setup.  Everything worked reasonably well for the first week or so.Then one night, I went to turn it on and nothing happened.  The power light came on, but no screen.  Not just no picture--even when I went to pull up menus, there was nothing.  Being the technology genius that I am, I performed step 1 of troubleshooting:  I unplugged it and plugged it back in, and it worked again!  Until a few days later when it randomly did the same thing again.  This time I let it sit overnight, and then the next morning it decided to start working again, this time for a couple of weeks.  Well, okay, maybe it's a fluke, I thought to myself.Tonight as I sat down to dinner, I went to turn on the TV and it started flickering rapidly, epilepsy-trigger style, between the screen image and the negative.  Checked all connections, all good, still flickering.  Tried multiple inputs, still flickering.  Unplugged, replugged, turned back on, still flickering.  Unplugged everything from the TV, still flickering.  Fiddled with all settings in every menu, still flickering.  Reset to all defaults, still flickering.  Let it sit for an hour (I don't know, it fixed itself last time *shrug*)... STILL FLICKERING.Taking it back tomorrow for store credit, which I'll put towards something I can trust to turn on when I push the power button.  Goddammit, Sharp, I wanted to believe in you.Edit the next day:  when talking to the delivery guy about coming to pick it up, he said he's taken 3 of these TV's back already since Black Friday.  When the delivery guy knows your TV is junk, your product has some serious issues...

Reviews.Title: picture quality poor until manually adjusted settings
Reviews.Author: David Kenney
Reviews.Content: Picture was not clear  and light /colors were off.  Looked on web for other users settings and applied these.  After that it was much better,  although the picture quality on my Samsung is better.  Also arranged with Amazon to deliver on a Saturday and it inconveniently came on a Friday morning.

Reviews.Title: its on ok entry level HD led tv
Reviews.Author: Zach Ruder
Reviews.Content: Picture quality on 1080 is a bit pixelated.  Easy to use.  Crappy speakers.  Worth the cheap price.  Not too heavy but has some weight.

Reviews.Title: Sharp LC-60LE550 60-inch Aquos 1080p 120Hz LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Scrap
Reviews.Content: This product was received exactly when it was supposed to. I installed it and started using it asap. The picture was as expected after I purchased an hdmi cable to connect to the dvr.

Reviews.Title: Awful
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with this tv. First off the picture was impossible to get to the point where i was happy with the picture quality. My old 40 inch element 60hz was better than this television. Then I found out once I tried to hook up my soundbar that the digital optical input on the tv was broken, tried it on another tv and it worked. Then i tried to use the USB port on the back of the television and it didn't work. So overall I was very unhappy with this purchase and I am sending it back

Reviews.Title: Good tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Matthew DeMea
Reviews.Content: This is my first led tv and the picture quality is awesome. checked it out at best buy first..it was the same price so I just bought it from amazon to not have to pay the taxes plus free two day shipping. lookin forward to having it for a long time.

Reviews.Title: If you want a big ugly picutre, then this is your TV
Reviews.Author: Matt B
Reviews.Content: I liked the idea of a no frills TV.  I didn't want or need applications or 3D.  I just wanted a BIG TV with a nice picture.  I was looking for 65" to 70" based on where we were going to put it.  I was really leaning toward a Panasonic Plasma, but opted to go just a bit bigger to a 70" instead.  Now I knew that the more expensive sets might have some advantages here or there, but I figured based on just the normal advancements of technology over time even the base model has to have an impressive picture too.  I'm not a videophile.  I just wanted a nice clean picture.  Well after watching this TV for a few days and trying out movies and sporting events (the 2 things we'll be using it for), I can say the picture is TERRIBLE.  The colors are WAY OFF.  I've played with a number of settings and even attempted to have it professionally calibrated.  It just looks bad.  Maybe I got a bad one?  Maybe there's a problem?  Or maybe it's just this model?  Caveat emptor.  I've already set up the return and ordered a different model.

Reviews.Title: If you want to automate this TV with a universal remote, forget it.
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: I've been automating TV's for about 20 years. In the past, the Sharp brand has been bulletproof with discrete codes but since they've changed their codes, the TV can no longer be automated well. PROFESSIONAL A/V guys. DO NOT BUY THIS TV!!!!!!!! No separate on/off

Reviews.Title: awesome tv
Reviews.Author: jimmy matos
Reviews.Content: easy to buyeasy to receiveeasy to setupeasy with plug and playeasy free shipping - what else can I say ! but it was sooooooooooo EASYthanks

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price.
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: Colors and picture look good on this TV.  Sound is impressive.  And the price is nice.  The look is not so sleek.  And it's not the smartest of TV's.  Good buy though.  If you're interested in this I also suggest you take a look at the TV link below. B009H8JOZS

Reviews.Title: Came defective, but Amazon took 2 weeks to pick it up so I had time to evaluate.
Reviews.Author: Lester Suppes
Reviews.Content: It's a low end panel, nothing pops, the side view is ok. I think you have to step up to higher models. I did manage to pick up a panasonic plasma to replace this, there is no comparison. LED tvs - meh.

Reviews.Title: Acceptable
Reviews.Author: Wade
Reviews.Content: We wanted a larger screen TV and had no use for such features as Smart, 3D, Internet, etc. We found three basic 60" units on Amazon bearing familiar brands. So we didn't think the brand would matter as once we set our screen preferences, the differences would be negligible. We chose this unit because of its small and non-intrusive bezel.With our HDMI input selected, the images were acceptable. We were also pleased to discover our TV ears speaker works fine with this unit.

Reviews.Title: thank youthank you
Reviews.Author: Frederick D Thomas
Reviews.Content: very nice t_v was the best 60 inch t_v 5. am on time thank you amazonreally a great price oil t_v decide

ProductInfo.Features:
AQUOS 1080p LED Display: Using photo-alignment technology that's precision crafted to let more light through in bright scenes and shut more light out in dark scenes, the AQUOS 1080p LED Display with a 4 million: 1 contrast ratio creates a picture so real you can see the difference.
120Hz Refresh Rate: See sharper, more electrifying action with the most advanced panel refresh rates available today.  120Hz technology delivers crystal-clear images even during fast-motion scenes.
Auto Brightness Control (OPC): Sharp OPC automatically adjusts picture brightness to the light in the room, cutting power consumption while giving you a more beautiful and comfortable picture to watch.
Slim Design: The brilliant AQUOS® LED display is embraced by a striking new frame that's thinner around the screen and slimmer in depth, so it can fit just about anywhere.
Powerful 20W Audio: High fidelity audio with Clear Voice technology.
ProductInfo.Name: Sharp LC-60LE550 60-inch Aquos 1080p 120Hz LED HDTV
